title: Is Season 6 really the worst season?
body: I was born into this darkness so it's all I know. But I obviously see the hate towards this season and can't fully understand it because I didn't play previous seasons. Are the problems with solo q the main reason it's been a bad season or did other seasons have something this one didn't ? I've seen people mention how previous seasons were more based on your strategy to win games and now it's more simple. That at least is easy for me to believe

Yes, it is the worst Season since I started playing in pre-Season 3.

I've only technically played since Season 5, despite starting in August 2014. I have to say, although Season 5's meta stagnated about halfway through (Jinx and Vayne were the only ADCs ever played, Thresh was the only support ever played, for example), the game had a different feel to it that I can't quite put to words. Games felt as if they didn't snowball hard, but at the same time, you felt rewarded if you performed well early on in a game. 

To be completely honest, the main reason I dislike this season is the fact that personal skill feels so invaluable versus working together as a team, but at the same time, it's as if this season people are just... worse. I don't mean that as an insult, it just feels like everyone has become less talented and either spams a champion due to its recently discovered power o because that's the only champion they use. I wouldn't even disclude myself from this, I main Karma and use her almost solely, but the season just feels like a downgrade and I'm not at all sure how it can be solved to be honest.

As a Jinx main, I can confirm that games snowballed VERY hard during that Jinx/Vayne time period. That was in fact the whole point of playing them. They're champions that snowball. Games are now SHORTER than season 5, but they are no more snowbally. The majority of games back then went until 40 minutes, but they were still decided in the early game. Teams would get an early lead, and hug towers, farm, and grow advantage until they're so far ahead they could stomp. That was what a lot of season 5 was: a lot of wasting time and sitting around.
You said it way better than I could! Games were definitely much longer back then, I suppose I just never felt that they were snowbally perhaps since they lasted so much longer. You are right though.

Personally. Season (Preseason) 7 so far is the worst season

Riot universally widened the MMR gap allowed via matchmaking with the introduction of Dynamic Queue in order to reduce queue times. 

This leads to extremely lopsided games, where one side is usually on a massive snowball. 

It effectively ruined the integrity of the game, ranked and all. **You can even feel it in normals, where it was often lopsided due to ranked and normal MMR being separate anyway. **

_____

I've been through it all, with the exception of Beta.

Despite all of the imbalance in previous seasons, you still got a relatively consistent experience because MMR ranges in matches were so tight.. Not this season, though.

And on top of that, balance-wise, this season is horrendous too, mostly due to keystones and the new mastery trees being massively lopsided towards damage.

________


At the end of the day, Dynamic Queue is an annoyance. Riot widening the MMR gap to reduce queue times is what actually ruined this season.

_Every_ season is the worst season, at least if you judge purely on Boards threads and comments. Early last year, Season 5 was the worst because of the new jungle, before that Season 4 was the worst because some mages got too good with the support item changes, plus Yasuo and Azir got released, before then Season 3 was the worst because Heart of Gold got removed, and so on. It's basically very easy to get stuck on the game's current issues this season, or just this patch, and complain that it's in its worst state yet, despite these problems being far less dire compared to those of the previous season: for example, Season 5's jungle was murder on all but a few champions, Season 4 had a tremendously snowbally laning phase, which meant only early game champions could ever be viable, Season 3 had supports build nothing but Vision Wards and a gold item, Season 2, despite being strangely popular among a few players here, featured balancing problems so hilariously terrible that they are still remembered to this day (Metagolem, anyone?), and Season 1 featured some of the game's most egregious mistakes in champion design, including release Irelia, Vladimir, Xin Zhao and Yorick, mistakes that took until very recently to begin fixing properly. For sure, Season 6 has its problems, but when put into perspective with League's entire run so far, it's probably the best the game's ever been, and that's not at all a bad thing.
